etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin unctio(n-), from unguere ‘anoint’. unction (sense 3) arises from the link between religious fervor and ‘anointing’ with the Holy Spirit

definitions: the action of anointing someone with oil or ointment as a religious rite or as a symbol of investiture as a monarch.
shortDefinitions: action of anointing someone with oil or ointment as religious rite or as symbol of investiture as monarch

definitions: treatment with a medicinal oil or ointment.
shortDefinitions: treatment with medicinal oil or ointment

examples.text: mercury in the form of unctions

definitions: a manner of expression arising or apparently arising from deep emotion, especially as intended to flatter

examples.text: he spoke the last two words with exaggerated unction

shortDefinitions: fervent manner of expression apparently arising from deep emotion
